text: Miranda Kerr Net Worth: Miranda Kerr is an Australian model who has a net worth of $45 million. Born in Sydney, Australia, in 1983, Miranda Kerr studied psychology and nutrition before deciding to focus on her modeling career. When she was 13 years old, Kerr won the "Dolly" and Impulse model competition in 1997. She signed with Chic Management and appeared in beachwear ads for Billabong. Kerr later moved to New York and signed with NEXT Model Management. She went on to appear in print and on runways for dozens of international brands, including Baby Phat, Levi's, L.A.M.B., Betsey Johnson, Neiman Marcus, and Roberto Cavalli. She scored ads in a variety of magazines, including "Harper's Bazaar" and "Elle". Kerr also appeared in the pages of "Vogue" in her native country. She modeled on the season finale of "Project Runway" in 2006 and soon became the face of Maybelline New York cosmetics. In 2007, she landed a job with Victoria's Secret, taking over for Gisele Bundchen and becoming the first Australian woman to be a VS Angel. Two years later, she launched her own line of skincare products with George Moskos called KORA Organics. Kerr is active in a variety of charities and posed naked and chained to a tree to raise awareness about endangered koalas in her home country. She published her first book, "Treasure Yourself", in 2010. Her contract with Victoria's Secret was not renewed in 2013. She released her debut single, a cover of Elvis' "You're the Boss", with Bobby Fox in the spring of 2014. "Forbes" estimated she was one of the top-ten highest-paid models in the world in 2008 and 2009. In 2007, she began dating actor Orlando Bloom. They wed in 2010 and Kerr gave birth to their son in 2011. She also became the first pregnant woman to ever appear on the pages of "Vogue" during this time. Kerr and Bloom later separated in 2013.
